text: and i'll give you a few examples right
so people are using speech technology to
diagnose disease i can listen to you
speak and detect
oh i think the way you're speaking
you're depressed or you have alzheimer's
or i can even detect
things like congestive heart failure and
things that you wouldn't necessarily
expect to be
related to speech so that's one we've
got speech
in education where we're helping not
just
coaching people but in general but
coaching on like
people learning a new language where we
can give them feedback on how well
they're speaking
we've got custom synthetic voices
that people build i'm mostly thinking of
things projects that we've taken on at
cobalt but this is not limited to what
cobalt is doing
people are doing really interesting
things there's a great company
vocal id that is records people's voices
people who know that they have to have
some surgery that lose their voice
they can record their voices ahead of
time and then create a synthetic voice
that sounds like them so that
later after they've lost their voice
they can still speak with their voice oh
that's really cool
it's a fantastic company and a great
technology and it's almost like
maintaining identity as well
exactly separate you know from just the
the physicalness of the voice itself
right we've got people who are using
voice to listen in on like
uh pilot conversations to detect when
they're fatigued
to recommend that they trade off with
the co-pilot or whatever whatever you
have to do to wake someone up that's
fatigue
we've got instances in education and
finance and
medicine and the thing that has been the
most fun for me in my career has been
these last six years or so
where i get to see so many different
interesting applications
and i don't have to think of them all
other people are coming to us saying
hey i'd like to use voice for financial
transactions or i'd like to use voice
for
whatever it is and we get to do that we
get to work with them and build those
things out
and we've got some great technology that
people are using in a lot of really cool
applications
it's fun to be a part of that
